oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Rick Riman tapes - tape 1 of 5 - side one - channel two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Bluegrass performances collected by Rick Riman. On loan from Craig S. Wales. Live personal appearances and recordings off of television. Audio is restricted. Contact for access.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bill Monroe and the Bluegrass Boys; Bobby Hicks; Charlie Cline; Vassar Clements; Bessie Lee Mauldin; Flatt and Scruggs and the Foggy Mountain Boys; Shenandoah Valley Trio; Fruit Jar Drinkers; Mac Wiseman;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:14) Don't Forget Me, Little Darling (Bill Monroe and the Bluegrass Boys from New River Ranch on July 31, 1955) / (02:13) Down Where The River Bends / (04:40) Have A Feast Here Tonight / (06:47) What Is A Home Without Love / (10:06) I've Found A Way / (12:16) He Will Set Your Fields On Fire (with Bobby Hicks and Charlie Cline) / (15:03) Foggy Mountain Top / (17:15) Goodbye Maggie / (20:12) The Girl In The Blue Velvet Band / (22:31) Monroe with an apology for having a broken collar bone and not being able to play mandolin / (23:51) Theme / (24:17) Wheel Hoss (1955-05-08) / (26:54) Get Up, John (1955-05-08) / (31:36) Opening Show Theme and partial introduction of band member Bessie Lee Mauldin (information vaguely indicates that this is again from the New River Ranch on July 31, 1955, but a different performance from above) / (32:08) Bile Them Cabbage Down (Vassar Clements-fiddle) / (33:14) I'm Gonna Fall Out Of Love With You (Charlie Cline-vocal) /

(35:08) Dear Old Dixie (Bobby Hicks - banjo) / (36:18) The Ballad Of Davy Crockett - incomplete (Shenandoah Valley Trio) / (37:42) Release Me (Bessie Lee Mauldin-vocal) / (39:43) Blue Moon Of Kentucky / (41:10) Close By / (43:38) Crying Holy Unto The Lord / (45:07) Just A Little Talk With Jesus / (46:35) Mule Skinner Blues / (48:21) Goodbye Old Pal / (15:17) Y'all Come (begins in progress) / (51:51) Bury Me Beneath the Weeping Willow Tree (Unidentified Performers-begins in progress) / (52:07) Reuben (Flatt and Scruggs and the Foggy Mountain Boy WSM Radio Show circa 1956) / (55:29) Camping In Canaan's Land / (57:53) Billy Wilson - incomplete (Paul Warren - fiddle) / (58:29) Blackberry Blossom (Paul Warren - fiddle) / (59:36) Maybe Next Week Sometime (Josh Graves - vocal) / (01:02:08) Foggy Mountain Breakdown / (01:04:08) Little Darling, Pal Of Mine (Jake Tullock and Earl Scruggs) / (01:05:48) Take Me Back To Tulsa (Fruit Jar Drinkers from the Grand Ole Opry-no date given) /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Typed content notes on notebook paper inserted in box;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Monroe, Bill; Clements, Vassar; Hicks, Bobby; Cline, Charles; Maudlin, Bessie Lee; Flatt, Lester; Scruggs, Earl; Graves, Josh; Warren, Paul; Tullock, Jake; Wiseman, Mac; Shenandoah Valley Trio (Musical group);
